He fights with,a fervor and savagery which you would not expect from an elf, and in fact,,his comrades look at him with a mixture of shock,and awe. Still, the sheer,brutality of his attacks stops the momentum of the assault, and he is able,to single-handedly turn the tide of the assault on the city.,The images suddenly shift to an enormous hall of gleamin blue coral where,the mighty warrior kneels, bound in chains. A flustered and angry group of,regal-looking dargonesti elves swim around him, arguing loudly about his,fate. They appear to be displeased that such savagery lies buried within,one of their own, and they refuse to admit to themselves that their slim,victory depended on his actions. They fear what he might be capable of if,he is left free to do as he pleases.,Then, the images shift again to show the warrior leading a small group of,tired exiles on a journey eastwards when they are suddenly ambushed by an,enormous sea creature with hundreds of writhing tentacles. As the others,flee to safety, the last thing you see is the mighty warrior attacking the,giant creature with his fearsome axe, cutting viciously into its left eye,before he is consumed by its inky black arms.Your axe is suddenly too heavy for,you to wield.,That axe is from spirit king fight in dargo I think#Time=2017-04-12 16:41:58#Submitter=James
